text:
One of the best JRPGS I've played in the seventh generation. A very unique setting;  great characters;  top-notch voice acting (especially from Jansen); and a fantastic soundtrack. Easily deserves an A and I would highly recommend it.

The Thousand Year Dreams were VERY well-written and translated; I would have loved to get the actual physical book in my hands so I can read it.

This game is actually inspiring one of the characters I'm creating a story for. To live for a thousand years like Kaim...the character I'm writing about could barely handle two-hundred.

text: My favorite JRPG of this generation so far that I've played. It actually felt like a mix of Final Fantasy and old school RPGs in general, with amazing music by Uematsu and nice story from Sakaguchi (with very memorable dream sequences that no one should skip). It's one of the few games where I actually felt some form of nostalgia while playing the game for the first time.
